snippet: Unlike the Democrats in 1988, the Republicans are not likely to seek to overhaul and modernize their platform in the event of a Romney loss, Matt Bai writes in this week's New York Times Magazine.
abstract: Unlike the Democrats in 1988, the Republicans are not likely to seek to overhaul and modernize their platform in the event of a Romney loss, Matt Bai writes in this week's New York Times Magazine.

headline.main: From the Magazine: Would a Romney Loss Lead to Republican Soul-Searching?
